Explanations for a Prediction Breakdown

Explanations for a Prediction Breakdown

This function is set deprecated. It is suggested to use break_down instead. Find information how to use these functions here: https://pbiecek.github.io/PM_VEE/breakDown.html.

prediction_breakdown(explainer, observation, ...)

Arguments

explainer

a model to be explained, preprocessed by the 'explain' function
observation

a new observarvation for which predictions need to be explained
...

other parameters that will be passed to breakDown::broken.default()

Value

An object of the class 'single_prediction_explainer'. It's a data frame with calculated average response.

References

Predictive Models: Visual Exploration, Explanation and Debugging https://pbiecek.github.io/PM_VEE/

Examples

new_dragon <- data.frame(year_of_birth = 200,
     height = 80,
     weight = 12.5,
     scars = 0,
     number_of_lost_teeth  = 5)

dragon_lm_model4 <- lm(life_length ~ year_of_birth + height +
                                     weight + scars + number_of_lost_teeth,
                       data = dragons)
dragon_lm_explainer4 <- explain(dragon_lm_model4, data = dragons, y = dragons$year_of_birth,
                                label = "model_4v")
#> Preparation of a new explainer is initiated
#>   -> model label       :  model_4v 
#>   -> data              :  2000  rows  8  cols 
#>   -> target variable   :  2000  values 
#>   -> predict function  :  yhat.lm  will be used (default)
#>   -> predicted values  :  numerical, min =  541.1056 , mean =  1370.986 , max =  3928.189  
#>   -> residual function :  difference between y and yhat (default)
#>   -> residuals         :  numerical, min =  -5421.316 , mean =  -1450.523 , max =  1176.912  
#> A new explainer has been created!
dragon_lm_predict4 <- prediction_breakdown(dragon_lm_explainer4, observation = new_dragon)
head(dragon_lm_predict4)
#>                                        variable contribution
#> 1                                   (Intercept)  1370.985690
#> scars                               + scars = 0  -397.299680
#> number_of_lost_teeth + number_of_lost_teeth = 5  -302.277210
#> height                            + height = 80    -9.733909
#> year_of_birth             + year_of_birth = 200    -6.638641
#> weight                          + weight = 12.5    -0.972658
#>                             variable_name variable_value cummulative sign
#> 1                               Intercept              1   1370.9857    1
#> scars                               scars              0    973.6860   -1
#> number_of_lost_teeth number_of_lost_teeth              5    671.4088   -1
#> height                             height             80    661.6749   -1
#> year_of_birth               year_of_birth            200    655.0363   -1
#> weight                             weight           12.5    654.0636   -1
#>                      position    label
#> 1                           1 model_4v
#> scars                       2 model_4v
#> number_of_lost_teeth        3 model_4v
#> height                      4 model_4v
#> year_of_birth               5 model_4v
#> weight                      6 model_4v
plot(dragon_lm_predict4)


library("randomForest")
dragon_rf_model4 <- randomForest(life_length ~ year_of_birth + height +
                                               weight + scars + number_of_lost_teeth,
                                 data = dragons)
dragon_rf_explainer4 <- explain(dragon_rf_model4, data = dragons, y = dragons$year_of_birth,
                                label = "model_rf")
#> Preparation of a new explainer is initiated
#>   -> model label       :  model_rf 
#>   -> data              :  2000  rows  8  cols 
#>   -> target variable   :  2000  values 
#>   -> predict function  :  yhat.randomForest  will be used (default)
#>   -> predicted values  :  numerical, min =  646.6838 , mean =  1369.984 , max =  3124.953  
#>   -> residual function :  difference between y and yhat (default)
#>   -> residuals         :  numerical, min =  -4695.953 , mean =  -1449.521 , max =  967.4731  
#> A new explainer has been created!
dragon_rf_predict4 <- prediction_breakdown(dragon_rf_explainer4, observation = new_dragon)
head(dragon_rf_predict4)
#>                                        variable contribution
#> 1                                   (Intercept)   1369.98384
#> scars                               + scars = 0   -276.74307
#> number_of_lost_teeth + number_of_lost_teeth = 5   -268.40211
#> weight                          + weight = 12.5     14.67167
#> year_of_birth             + year_of_birth = 200     14.12063
#> height                            + height = 80    182.45780
#>                             variable_name variable_value cummulative sign
#> 1                               Intercept              1   1369.9838    1
#> scars                               scars              0   1093.2408   -1
#> number_of_lost_teeth number_of_lost_teeth              5    824.8387   -1
#> weight                             weight           12.5    839.5103    1
#> year_of_birth               year_of_birth            200    853.6310    1
#> height                             height             80   1036.0888    1
#>                      position    label
#> 1                           1 model_rf
#> scars                       2 model_rf
#> number_of_lost_teeth        3 model_rf
#> weight                      4 model_rf
#> year_of_birth               5 model_rf
#> height                      6 model_rf
plot(dragon_rf_predict4)

library("gbm")
# create a gbm model
model <- gbm(life_length ~ year_of_birth + height + weight + scars +
                           number_of_lost_teeth, data = dragons,
             distribution = "gaussian",
             n.trees = 1000,
             interaction.depth = 4,
             shrinkage = 0.01,
             n.minobsinnode = 10,
             verbose = FALSE)
 # make an explainer for the model
 explainer_gbm <- explain(model, data = dragons, predict_function =
         function(model, x) predict(model, x, n.trees = 1000))
#> Preparation of a new explainer is initiated
#>   -> model label       :  gbm  (default)
#>   -> data              :  2000  rows  8  cols 
#>   -> target variable   :  not specified! (WARNING)
#>   -> predict function  :  function(model, x) predict(model, x, n.trees = 1000) 
#>   -> predicted values  :  numerical, min =  585.942 , mean =  1370.963 , max =  3567.821  
#>   -> residual function :  difference between y and yhat (default)
#> A new explainer has been created!
 # create a new observation
 exp_sgn <- prediction_breakdown(explainer_gbm, observation = new_dragon)
 head(exp_sgn)
#>                                        variable  contribution
#> 1                                   (Intercept) 1370.96312605
#> scars                               + scars = 0 -388.37059527
#> number_of_lost_teeth + number_of_lost_teeth = 5 -302.19501452
#> weight                          + weight = 12.5   -0.16735659
#> height                            + height = 80    0.09309097
#> year_of_birth             + year_of_birth = 200   19.23393828
#>                             variable_name variable_value cummulative sign
#> 1                               Intercept              1   1370.9631    1
#> scars                               scars              0    982.5925   -1
#> number_of_lost_teeth number_of_lost_teeth              5    680.3975   -1
#> weight                             weight           12.5    680.2302   -1
#> height                             height             80    680.3233    1
#> year_of_birth               year_of_birth            200    699.5572    1
#>                      position label
#> 1                           1   gbm
#> scars                       2   gbm
#> number_of_lost_teeth        3   gbm
#> weight                      4   gbm
#> height                      5   gbm
#> year_of_birth               6   gbm
 plot(exp_sgn)

 exp_sgn <- prediction_breakdown(explainer_gbm, observation = new_dragon, baseline = 0)
 plot(exp_sgn)
